subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*maŋ||big; old; elder (brother, uncle)}}; cognate with {{cog|nun|ʈhi³¹ mɑŋ³¹||old; elderly}}, {{cog|duu|tr=də maŋ|gloss=big; elder (brother, uncle)}}{{attn|duu|tvmvng?}}, {{cog|my|မင်း||monarch; king}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}; STEDT).

Likely related to {{och-l|兄|older brother}} ({{zh-ref|Sagart, 1999}}; STEDT). Perhaps also related to {{och-l|芒|great; extensive}} and {{och-l|荒|vast; excessive; senile}} ({{zh-ref|Sagart, 1999}}; {{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
